channel.title: The New Xbox 360
channel.description:
Anyone thinking of getting it? Looks good
I'm thinking of getting one simply because i wouldnt mind playing on one again and i dont want to fork out shit loads for a wireless adapter+ the fact it looks good.
Serious opinions?

item.title: The New Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Sega > Xbox

Read full topic

item.title: The New Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

The new X-Box 360 – Fuck the RROD. Now your X-Box overheats unexpectadly WITH the RROD.

Read full topic

item.title: The New Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I have to admit I do like the new layout, but I don’t want it I already have an Xbox360 which I can play all my games on and play online. So I won’t be buying one, I’d rather spend my money on games.

Read full topic

item.title: The New Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:119, topic:348979”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=445350.msg3281191#msg3281191 date=1279890149]
It’s quite naive to just assume that the Slim will be a disaster.

Sure, the 360 used to overheat and shit in the past, but don’t forget that it’s a learning curve for MS.
The new gen of 360’s they released didn’t have that problem, and surely the slim won’t.
Why would they embarrass themselves further with the same mistake twice?

Problems can be found within anything.
Oh my god, no one is perfect? shit.
[/quote]

It’s not like the 360 was microsoft’s first console, they did make a regular Xbox before that, right? They should have recalled them all and fixed the problem, instead of just extending warranties for one or two problems. I think it would be naive to assume microsoft fixed all the problems with this new version.[/quote]
First Xbox didn’t have overheating problem, duh.
I focused on the overheating problem only, not all problems. Calm down with allegations lol?

I think It’s naive to hate on anything that’s popular or branded.
Wish I could be indie/alternative like you and not some shitty mainstream fag.
cool!

Read full topic

item.title: The New Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“super_, post:120, topic:348979”]my slim runs extremely quiet – virtually no noise. although it did scratch a couple of my disks…[/quote]Yeh, same problem here.

First thing I did when I got my slim was open it up (blah blah I don’t care about my warranty, whatever goes I could probably fix myself), and found the problem to be with the DVD drive’s placement when going from a horizontal placement to vertical.

I installed some pads on the top of the DVD-drive chasis and it worked perfect.

Read full topic

item.title: The New Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

my slim runs extremely quiet – virtually no noise. although it did scratch a couple of my disks…

item.title: The New Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:114, topic:348979”]It’s quite naive to just assume that the Slim will be a disaster.

Sure, the 360 used to overheat and shit in the past, but don’t forget that it’s a learning curve for MS.
The new gen of 360’s they released didn’t have that problem, and surely the slim won’t.
Why would they embarrass themselves further with the same mistake twice?

Problems can be found within anything.
Oh my god, no one is perfect? shit.[/quote]

It’s not like the 360 was microsoft’s first console, they did make a regular Xbox before that, right? They should have recalled them all and fixed the problem, instead of just extending warranties for one or two problems. I think it would be naive to assume microsoft fixed all the problems with this new version.

Read full topic

Which is the same as the 360, that has loads of games - just a few worth buying a 360 for.

As a games console, it is still lacking a few important factors, like games,
[/quote]

Quite a few parallels with the Wii, then.[/quote]

Wii has hundreds of games, just 2-3 of them are worth playing.

item.dc:creator: @tL tL

@John459 wrote:

item.title: The New Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Hah. Well, this one seems much better built - it is, believe it or not, quieter than the Wii. That is quite a feat if you ask me.

As a games console, it is still lacking a few important factors, like games, but XBLA games are a good enough reason to own the console, i suppose.

Read full topic

item.title: The New Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Nah, because they would of had people playing them off backups if they could. When someone found a way into the system (through linux) sony blocked that off and no progress has been made since then.

A games console at 37million sold would of had at least SOMEONE do it for the sake of doing it.

Read full topic

item.title: The New Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Thug-life:

Yeah, they haven’t actually managed to get the system to play pirated games yet. That is fairly unprecedented for a games console, its coming on to 4 years on the market.

I’d say it’s basically due to the prohibitive costs of blu ray media. If it played DVDs it would already be hacked I’m sure.

Read full topic

item.title: The New Xbox 360
